description.narrative:
AADK believes that structural causes within inter-personal, national and international relations keep millions of people in undue poverty, but we are convinced that structures can be altered. Fundamental changes are imperative in order to eradicate poverty. AADK believes that change can happen when people unite to challenge existing power structures and demand their rights. Crucial factors are knowledge, solidarity across borders and a strong joint understanding of democracy. That is why AADK strives to offer people living in poverty and exclusion the opportunity to organise and demand democratic, sustainable and rights-based alternatives which encompass a just distribution of resources. And that is why AADK supports the efforts of civil society organisations and movements who fight poverty, by supporting their capacity development and by influencing Danish and international decision-makers to change the structural causes of poverty and inequality.
AADK shares their vision with ActionAid International – a vision of a sustainable world without poverty and injustice, in which every person enjoys their right to a life of dignity. The mission of AADK is to work with poor and excluded people to eradicate poverty and injustice. AADK seeks to create democratic and sustainable development alternatives in partnership with organisations and movements in other parts of the world. AADK seeks to offer an opportunity for action to everybody who is ready to share the responsibility for global sustainable development.
